ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: your Lord has not abandoned you nor does He hate you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Your Lord has neither left you, nor despises you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (O Prophet), your Lord has neither forsaken you, nor is He displeased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), your Lord has not abandoned you (by not sending you His revelation), nor is He displeased with you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Your Lord has not forsaken you nor does He dislike you!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Your Lord has neither forsaken you nor hates you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Your Lord has not forsaken you, nor has He become displeased,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Thy Lord has neither forsaken thee nor hates thee
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Thy Lord hath not forsaken thee nor doth He hate thee,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: your Lord has not forsaken you, nor is He displeased with you,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Thy Lord hath not forsaken thee, nor is He displeased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Your Lord has neither forsaken you, nor is He displeased with you,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Thy Guardian-Lord hath not forsaken thee, nor is He displeased.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Your Lord (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) has neither forsaken you nor hated you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: your Lord has not forsaken you (Prophet Muhammad), nor does He hate you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Your Lord did not abandon you, nor did He forget.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muhammad], nor has He detested [you].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [93:3] Your Lord has neither forsaken you, He has [not] abandoned you, O Muhammad (s), nor does He hate you: this was revealed when, after the revelation had not come to him for fifteen days, the disbelievers said, ‘His Lord has parted with him and hates him’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Thy Lord hath not forsaken thee) your Lord has not left you since He inspired you (nor doth He hate thee) since He loved you; this is the reason for Allah's oath, this was revealed after the revelations from Allah stopped for 15 nights because the Prophet (pbuh) forgot to say "if Allah wills" when he promised the idolaters to answer their questions. And because the revelations stopped for this period of time the idolaters said: the Lord of Prophet has forsaken him and He hates him.
